targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  (SELECT temperature_c
   FROM max6675_temperature_data
   WHERE device_id='ESP32_SensorHub_Raptor'
   ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 1)      AS "Hot-end °C",
  (SELECT power_w
   FROM smartplug_data
   WHERE device_id LIKE '%smartplug%'
   ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 1)       AS "Power W";

WITH power_efficiency AS (
  SELECT 
    s.timestamp,
    s.power_w,
    s.power_factor,
    d.temperature_c as ambient_temp,
    d.humidity_pct as humidity,
    m.temperature_c as hotend_temp,
    -- Calculate efficiency based on power factor and environmental conditions
    s.power_factor * 100 - (ABS(d.temperature_c - 22) * 0.5) - (ABS(d.humidity_pct - 50) * 0.3) as efficiency_score
  FROM smartplug_data s
  LEFT JOIN dht22_data d ON d.timestamp BETWEEN s.timestamp - INTERVAL '1 minute' AND s.timestamp + INTERVAL '1 minute'
    AND d.device_id = 'ESP32_SensorHub_Raptor'
  LEFT JOIN max6675_temperature_data m ON m.timestamp BETWEEN s.timestamp - INTERVAL '1 minute' AND s.timestamp + INTERVAL '1 minute'
    AND m.device_id = 'ESP32_SensorHub_Raptor'
  WHERE $__timeFilter(s.timestamp)
    AND s.device_id LIKE '%smartplug%'
)
SELECT 
  timestamp AS "time",
  power_w AS "Power Consumption (W)",
  efficiency_score AS "Efficiency Score",
  ambient_temp AS "Ambient Temp (°C)",
  humidity AS "Humidity (%)"
FROM power_efficiency
ORDER BY timestamp;

SELECT 
  power_w AS "Current Power",
  voltage_v AS "Voltage",
  current_a AS "Current",
  power_factor AS "Power Factor"
FROM smartplug_data
WHERE device_id LIKE '%smartplug%'
ORDER BY timestamp DESC
LIMIT 1;

WITH vibration_metrics AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    sqrt(accel_x^2 + accel_y^2 + accel_z^2) as vibration_magnitude,
    sqrt(gyro_x^2 + gyro_y^2 + gyro_z^2) as rotation_magnitude
  FROM mpu6050_accelerometer_data a
  JOIN mpu6050_gyroscope_data g USING (timestamp, device_id, printer_id)
  WHERE device_id = 'ESP32_SensorHub_Raptor'
    AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
),
temp_data AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    temperature_c as hotend_temp
  FROM max6675_temperature_data
  WHERE device_id = 'ESP32_SensorHub_Raptor'
    AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
)
SELECT 
  v.timestamp AS "time",
  v.vibration_magnitude AS "Vibration Level",
  v.rotation_magnitude AS "Rotation Level",
  t.hotend_temp AS "Hotend Temperature",
  -- Correlation indicator
  CASE 
    WHEN v.vibration_magnitude > 5 AND t.hotend_temp > 200 THEN 'High Vibration @ Printing Temp'
    WHEN v.vibration_magnitude > 5 AND t.hotend_temp < 50 THEN 'High Vibration @ Cold'
    ELSE 'Normal'
  END AS "Status"
FROM vibration_metrics v
LEFT JOIN temp_data t ON t.timestamp BETWEEN v.timestamp - INTERVAL '5 seconds' AND v.timestamp + INTERVAL '5 seconds'
ORDER BY v.timestamp;

WITH movement_patterns AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    accel_x, accel_y, accel_z,
    gyro_x, gyro_y, gyro_z,
    -- Detect primary movement axis
    CASE 
      WHEN ABS(accel_x) > ABS(accel_y) AND ABS(accel_x) > ABS(accel_z) THEN 'X-Axis Movement'
      WHEN ABS(accel_y) > ABS(accel_x) AND ABS(accel_y) > ABS(accel_z) THEN 'Y-Axis Movement'
      WHEN ABS(accel_z) > ABS(accel_x) AND ABS(accel_z) > ABS(accel_y) THEN 'Z-Axis Movement'
      ELSE 'Stationary'
    END as primary_movement,
    -- Detect rotation
    CASE 
      WHEN ABS(gyro_x) > 50 OR ABS(gyro_y) > 50 OR ABS(gyro_z) > 50 THEN 'Rotating'
      ELSE 'Stable'
    END as rotation_status
  FROM mpu6050_accelerometer_data a
  JOIN mpu6050_gyroscope_data g USING (timestamp, device_id, printer_id)
  WHERE device_id = 'ESP32_SensorHub_Raptor'
    AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
)
SELECT 
  timestamp AS "time",
  primary_movement AS "Movement Pattern",
  COUNT(*) OVER (PARTITION BY primary_movement ORDER BY timestamp ROWS BETWEEN 100 PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as "Pattern Count",
  rotation_status AS "Rotation Status"
FROM movement_patterns
ORDER BY timestamp;

SELECT
  timestamp AS "time",
  temperature_c AS "Hotend Temperature (°C)"
FROM max6675_temperature_data
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  AND device_id = 'ESP32_SensorHub_Raptor'
  AND printer_id = 'PRUSA_MK3_Test_TR'
ORDER BY timestamp;

SELECT
  temperature_c AS "Hotend Temperature"
FROM max6675_temperature_data
WHERE
  device_id = 'ESP32_SensorHub_Raptor'
  AND printer_id = 'PRUSA_MK3_Test_TR'
ORDER BY timestamp DESC
LIMIT 1;

SELECT
  timestamp AS "time",
  accel_x AS "Accel X",
  accel_y AS "Accel Y",
  accel_z AS "Accel Z"
FROM mpu6050_accelerometer_data
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  AND device_id = 'ESP32_SensorHub_Raptor'
  AND printer_id = 'PRUSA_MK3_Test_TR'
ORDER BY timestamp;

SELECT
  timestamp AS "time",
  gyro_x AS "Gyro X",
  gyro_y AS "Gyro Y",
  gyro_z AS "Gyro Z"
FROM mpu6050_gyroscope_data
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  AND device_id = 'ESP32_SensorHub_Raptor'
  AND printer_id = 'PRUSA_MK3_Test_TR'
ORDER BY timestamp;

WITH EnergyPoints AS (
    -- Select energy data for the chosen device and time range from Grafana
    SELECT
        timestamp,
        device_id,
        power_watts
    FROM energy_data
    WHERE
        -- Use Grafana's time range filter macros
        timestamp BETWEEN $__timeFrom() AND $__timeTo()
        -- Use a Grafana variable for device selection (assuming you create one named 'deviceId')
        -- Replace 'PrusaMK4-1' with ${deviceId:sqlstring} if using a variable
        AND device_id = 'PrusaMK4-1'  -- <-- *** Replace this with your Grafana variable later ***
)
-- For each energy point, find the latest printer status at or before that time
SELECT
    ep.timestamp AS "time", -- Grafana expects 'time' for the time column
    ep.power_watts AS "Power (W)", -- Series name for Grafana legend/panel
    ps.nozzle_temp_actual AS "Nozzle Temp (°C)", -- Series name
    ps.bed_temp_actual AS "Bed Temp (°C)", -- Series name
    -- Convert boolean is_printing to a number for plotting
    CASE WHEN ps.is_printing THEN 10 ELSE 0 END AS "Printing (10=Y)" -- Series name
FROM EnergyPoints ep
LEFT JOIN LATERAL (
    -- Subquery to find the single most recent status record
    SELECT
        nozzle_temp_actual,
        bed_temp_actual,
        is_printing
    FROM printer_status
    WHERE
        -- Match device and ensure status timestamp is not in the future relative to the energy point
        device_id = ep.device_id AND timestamp <= ep.timestamp
    ORDER BY timestamp DESC -- Get the latest one
    LIMIT 1
) ps ON true -- Always join; the LATERAL subquery handles finding the correct record (or NULLs if none found)
ORDER BY "time" ASC; -- Order by the aliased time column for Grafana

SELECT
  timestamp AS "time",
  power_watts AS "Actual Power"
FROM energy_data
WHERE
  device_id = $deviceId AND $__timeFilter(timestamp) -- Use dashboard variables
ORDER BY time ASC

SELECT
  timestamp AS "time",
  predicted_power_watts AS "Predicted Power"
FROM ml_predictions
WHERE
  device_id = $deviceId AND
  model_version = 'linear_regression_v1' AND -- Filter for this model if needed
  $__timeFilter(timestamp) -- Use dashboard variables
ORDER BY time ASC

SELECT
  forecast_time AS time,
  temperature,
  humidity
FROM weather_forecast
WHERE location = 'Hamburg'
ORDER BY time

-- Basic comparison query
SELECT 
    timestamp,
    actual_power,
    predicted_power,
    difference
FROM power_predictions
ORDER BY timestamp DESC;

-- Moving average of prediction accuracy
SELECT 
    timestamp,
    actual_power,
    predicted_power,
    AVG(difference) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp ROWS BETWEEN 10 PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as avg_difference
FROM power_predictions
ORDER BY timestamp;

panels.title: Actual vs Predicted Energy Consumption of Monitor Screen (Exp)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
    temperature 
FROM temperature_readings 
ORDER BY timestamp DESC 
LIMIT 1;

SELECT
  timestamp,
  rain_3h,
  snow_3h
FROM weather_forecast
WHERE location = 'Hamburg'
ORDER BY timestamp
LIMIT 40

SELECT
  forecast_time AS time,
  rain_3h AS rain,
  snow_3h AS snow
FROM weather_forecast
WHERE location = 'Hamburg'
ORDER BY time

panels.title: Compare rain and snow amounts at different times

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  humidity as value
FROM weather_readings

SELECT
  MAX(rain_3h) AS max_rain,
  MAX(snow_3h) AS max_snow
FROM weather_forecast
WHERE location = 'Hamburg'

SELECT
  timestamp,
  weather,
  description,
  temperature,
  humidity,
  pressure,
  wind_speed,
  wind_direction,
  rain_3h,
  snow_3h
FROM weather_forecast
WHERE location = 'Hamburg'
ORDER BY timestamp DESC
LIMIT 40

SELECT
  forecast_time AS time,
  rain_3h AS rain,
  snow_3h AS snow
FROM weather_forecast
WHERE location = 'Hamburg'
ORDER BY time
